pullRequest.title: Hive profile names now split "protocol" and "format"
pullRequest.bodyText:
The hive profile names do not follow the "protocol":"format" naming
convention introduced for HCFS profiles. This commit adds Hive profile
names with the new format. For example, HiveORC becomes hive:orc.

nodes.bodyText:
looks like this replaces the Hive profile name with hive, and adds new hive:xxx profiles for the others?  will the user still be able to use Hive?
are we going to want to deprecate the old Hive* profile names in 6.0.0?

Let's make them case-insensitive in the code and lower-cases in documentation / this file. This will apply to Hive, Jdbc, HBase, etc. The old one-word capitalized names will still work, but will be effectively deprecated. Composite ones like HiveORC will be deprecated, meaning they will still work for now, but will not be documented.

should we do hive:orc:vectorized ? Or better yet give it as a user option VECTORIZE=true since other profiles might also want to support vectorized execution or we can even auto-apply it if necessary ?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        GPDBWritable and TEXT output formats, as specified in FORMAT header parameter. Primary
          
          
            
                        GPDBWritable and TEXT output formats, as specified in FORMAT header parameter. Primarily

beforeCommit.message:
Hive profile names now split "protocol" and "format"

The hive profile names do not follow the "protocol":"format" naming
convention introduced for HCFS profiles. This commit adds Hive profile
names with the new format. For example, `HiveORC` becomes `hive:orc`.

nodes.bodyText: should we do a case insensitive check here? or are we always lowercasing the profiles?
we can use a real RequestContext, any reason why not instantiate an object for the test?
i see that we always lowercase the profile

commit.message:
Hive profile names now split "protocol" and "format"

The hive profile names do not follow the "protocol":"format" naming
convention introduced for HCFS profiles. This commit adds Hive profile
names with the new format. For example, `HiveORC` becomes `hive:orc`.
